Verification of Piling Design and Layout
Compliance with approved drawings and geotechnical report
Schletter FS DUO - Fixed-tilt Installation Manual
Schletter Piling Instructions for Maungaturoto Solar Farm

In terms of the Piling Operation, in the event that early refusal is not observed, the Pile Testing done by Schletter prior to the construction phase is the extent of the Pile Testing done. Please refer to the Pile Testing Report provided for further details.
Compliance with specifications (e.g., grade, dimensions, corrosion resistance)
Client Review of ULS Testing and Geotechnical Reports
Visual Inspection of alignment and marking of pile locations
Visual Inspection of clearing and levelling of the site
Free from debris, vegetation, and obstructions
Inspect equipment and tools for installation
Schletter FS Duo Fixed-tilt Installation Manual
Schletter Piling Instructions for Maungaturoto Solar Farm
Piles installed in the correct locations as per Schletter drawings and electronics Setout data
All piles in every table are installed to the designs and every pile is checked for the following tolerances:
Height difference foundation posts within one row +/- 50mm
Piles have no damage deformation and in correct orientation
Piling ITCs completed for each table
Drive piles to marked embedment depth or until they reach the point of refusal
Pile locations recorded and marked in Piling Maps
Record Actual Pile embedment Depth and reveal heights in Data Tracker
Pile refusal in accordance with Pile Installation Manual
Piles cut and holes drilled and cold galvanising applied as per Schletter Installation Instructions
Piles are installed to a minimum driven depth of 1.8m

If Pile refusal is found at 1.5-1.7m Perform individual Pile Test with Vertical SLS Load: 11.31kN with a displacement of less than 5mm after resetting to 0kN and Horizontal SLS Load: 5.77kN with a displacement of less than 5mm after resetting to a load of 0kN.

If Pile refusal is found at shallow depth of <1.5m consider predrilling a 300mm diameter hole to a minimum of 1.5m in depth and backfill with stabilised sands and perform one pile test per area to determine foundation strength.
Piling ITC's completed for each table
Predrill pile holes to be drilled and cleaned out to a minimum of 1.5m deep and results recorded
Predrill holes are a minimum of 300mm diameter and results recorded
Pile Predrill holes are backfilled with an approved material
Predrilling ITC's completed for each table
Top 30mm of each pile must be sealed with an appropriate zinc coating as per Schletter FS Duo Installation Manual
Application of zinc protection follow paint manufacturers recommendations
Predrilling ITC's completed for each table

If Pile refusal is found at 1.5-1.7m Perform individual Pile Test with Vertical SLS Load: 11.31kN with a displacement of less than 5mm after resetting to 0kN and Horizontal SLS Load: 5.77kN with a displacement of less than 5mm after resetting to a load of 0kN.

If Pile refusal is found at shallow depth of <1.5m predrilling a 300mm diameter hole to a minimum of 1.5m in depth and backfill with an approved material and perform one pile test per area to determine foundation strength.

Torqued to value of +/- 5% of 56Nm and pass/fail recorded

K&T to check 100%, United Civil to check 15%, CHINT to Check 5%

All Angles of the Girders to the horizontal are an angle of 23° +/- 1°

M10x35 bolt and nut tightened to a torque of +/- 5% of 32Nm
M21x30 bolt and nut tightened to a torque of +/- 5% of 56Nm
